message: So, I talked to Alex Gaynor briefly.  No promises on if he can make it or not, but if he does, I think that one of his summer projects might be Django -> py3k
I don't know.  I appreciated the Monday sprint at least.
I also don't know if Morgan is planning on attending/sprinting, but he knows a good bit about Fabric, and it could be a good sprint.
also: could just sprint Mon and Tues evening, not daytime; or declare hours of 4 pm - 12 pm or something like that

Last year's Saturday and Sunday evening sprints were awesome, thick with sprinters and great atmosphere.  I couldn't make Mon and Tuesday evenings, but Mon and Tue daytime sprints were very sedate.  Should we drop Mon and Tues sprints?  Should we add a Friday evening sprint?
How did sprints @ <insert fast food joint here> work?
I thought the Subway was pretty ideal, once the A/C was on.  Doing the finale at the donut shop was neat, too.
the disadvantage of Friday sprints, of course, is that they let people start PyOhio pre-exhausted.  :)  But some people wanted them enough that they did impromptu ones anyway last year
@issackelly as soon as he knows, let's start publicizing it.  I think a few well-attended sprints is better than a bunch with 1-2 people, and I think letting people know in advance helps with that
@catherinedevlin I support a Friday sprint I think, or a Friday event.  a surprising number of people come in and stay @ a hotel
Speaking of, a represenative of one of the hotels contacted the -organizers list, but all the organizers are local I think, so did anybody follow up with that?
@issackelly ah, that calls for a new topic.  coming right up...
cool.  Not much is 24/7 there.  McDonalds is also 24/7 (I think) with wifi
right, and summer hours are shorter
oh, right
what about a social instead of a sprint Friday night?
(new topic?)
don't yet know if budget would cover food for a social, but holding it at a restaurant is pretty foolproof
@issackelly Social sounds really good.  Doesn't have to be instead of sprints, either.
We might be able to donate space for a socail, depending on the number of people
I'd be down to sprint on Fabric, or anything really.
& if you didn't hear: I'll lead some Python Standard Library bugfixing if you're not interested in the other sprint topics.
OK, I'm holding down the fort at Subway while Emma gets the rest of you properly sauced at Eddie George's.  See you in a while once you're ready for your Ballmer peak.
Subway is closed. Things dissipated after leaving subway.
(hm, I don't see anyone)
Heading out to Subway to see if anyone's still there!

I just want to say thanks to everyone that helped hack on Bookie. I'm sorry I didn't have a better solution to the large array of package requirements. I've already added a couple of new tickets to help with some of the issues hit. And it looks like we might have a solid patch coming soon.
Glad I checked! Anyone hacking in the Blackwell lobby again?

The Bookie installfest/sprint was fun last night. I heard one person is about ready to push a patch. There were some questions about fabric at the Sprint, and I see there's a talk on it today. Good timing!
Did anyone get pics of the sprints last night? I completely forgot to use my camera I had in my pocket the whole time. :/
I did, I'll upload them to various sites tonight.
For anyone that didn't want the hassle of setting up Bookie, but want to try it out/help test you can request an account with the form: http://goo.gl/BBn2b
